description: College-level algebra-based physics problems covering fluids, thermodynamics, electricity, magnetism, optics, and modern physics. Prepare for the AP Physics 2 exam with comprehensive practice questions and detailed solutions.

topics.name: Unit 1: Fluids
topics.description: Pressure, density, buoyancy, Archimedes' principle, Pascal's principle, fluid dynamics, continuity equation, Bernoulli's equation, and viscosity

topics.name: Unit 2: Thermodynamics
topics.description: Temperature, thermal expansion, ideal gas law, kinetic theory, internal energy, heat transfer, first and second laws of thermodynamics, heat engines, and entropy

topics.name: Unit 3: Electric Force, Field & Potential
topics.description: Coulomb's law, electric fields, superposition, Gauss's law, electric potential energy, electric potential, equipotential surfaces, and capacitors

topics.name: Unit 4: Electric Circuits
topics.description: Current, resistance, Ohm's law, power, series and parallel circuits, Kirchhoff's laws, RC circuits, ammeters, voltmeters, and circuit analysis

topics.name: Unit 5: Magnetism & EM Induction
topics.description: Magnetic fields, magnetic force on charges and currents, Amp√®re's law, Biot-Savart law, Faraday's law, Lenz's law, inductance, and electromagnetic waves

topics.name: Unit 6: Geometric & Physical Optics
topics.description: Reflection, refraction, Snell's law, total internal reflection, thin lenses, mirrors, ray diagrams, interference, diffraction, double-slit experiment, and polarization

topics.name: Unit 7: Quantum, Atomic & Nuclear Physics
topics.description: Photoelectric effect, photons, de Broglie wavelength, atomic models, energy levels, spectra, nuclear structure, radioactive decay, mass defect, binding energy, and fission/fusion
